intro: Ischyrolepis helenae, commonly known as the Helen's rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often growing in alpine environments. Ischyrolepis helenae is a perennial species that produces a basal rosette of leaves and is adapted to cold, high-altitude climates.
